p: Preliminary investigation of the in vitro vibriocidal activities of three medicinal plants (traditional Ogi-tutu, Psidium guajava, and Vernonia amygdalina), using agar cup diffusion assay, showed that V. amygdalina has the highest ameliorative effects in the deterrence and cure of V. cholerae infection [ 60]. Moreover, a study has revealed the antibacterial property of T. vulgaris on multiple antibiotic-resistant Vibrio fluvialis and Vibrio parahaemolyticus isolated from shrimps using agar diffusion method [ 61]. The examination of Argemone mexicana L. for antimicrobial activity showed that the aerial and root extracts inhibited B. subtilis and K. pneumoniae, but P. aeruginosa and S. aureus were not prone to the aerial and root extracts.
